Qualifiers.Scope: Measuring the height of a building or structure on land with natural slope less than or equal to 10 percent.
Qualifiers.Applicability: Each building or structure on a site where the natural slope is ≤ 10%.
Exclusions: Fill or grading is excluded from the reference grade; the measurement references existing ground prior to grading or fill.
Ambiguity_Flags: Figure 44 label includes 'Height measured to [illegible] highest point'—the exact top measurement point is not fully legible (likely the highest point of the structure/roof).

natural_slope_percent.description: Natural slope of the land prior to grading or fill.

existing_grade_elevation_lowest_adjacent.description: Lowest point of adjacent ground elevation prior to grading or fill for the subject building/structure.

height_measurement_top_point.description: Top point to which height is measured.
height_measurement_top_point.note: Text suggests 'highest point' but is not fully legible in Figure 44.

Constants.reference_grade_definition: Existing Grade = for each building or structure, the lowest point of adjacent ground elevation prior to grading or fill.

then: Measure building/structure height from reference_grade to the top measurement point (see ambiguity).

Relationships.description: Measurement regime selection is based on natural slope threshold (≤ 10%).
Existing Grade is defined independently of any subsequent fill or grading.
Illustrated by Figure 44 on the same page.

Qualifiers.Scope: Measuring the height of a building or structure on land with natural slope greater than 10 percent and applying height limits on sloping sites.
Qualifiers.Applicability: Any building or structure at any point along its extent where the site’s natural slope is > 10%.

Figures: Figure 45 (Height limits for structures on slopes greater than 10%)

natural_slope_percent.description: Natural slope of the land prior to grading or fill.

existing_grade_elevation_at_point.description: Existing (pre-fill) adjacent ground elevation at a given point along the structure.

finished_grade_elevation_at_point.description: Finished (post-fill) adjacent ground elevation at a given point along the structure.

reference_grade_at_point.description: Lower of existing or finished adjacent ground elevation at the given point (per-point evaluation).

structure_height_at_point.description: Vertical height of the structure measured at the given point from the reference grade to the top measurement point.

Constants.grade_definition: Grade = adjacent ground elevation of the finished or existing grade, whichever is lower—at any point of the structure.
Constants.controlling_limit_rule: The structure must comply with the lower of the two limits (30' above existing grade, 30' above finished grade) at all points along the slope.
Constants.equivalency_note: Because both limits are 30', the controlling surface equals 30' above the lower of existing or finished grade at each point.

then: At each point along the structure, set reference_grade_at_point = min(existing_grade_elevation_at_point, finished_grade_elevation_at_point).
Maximum allowed structure height at that point = 30 feet above reference_grade_at_point.
Ensure the structure complies with this limit at all points along the slope.

Relationships.description: Per-point evaluation depends on both existing and finished grade elevations; the lower controls.
Limiting height surface defined as min(existing+30', finished+30') is equivalent to 30' above min(existing, finished).
Illustrated by Figure 45 with callouts '30' above existing grade', '30' above finished', and compliance with lower limit along the slope.
Measurement regime selection is based on natural slope threshold (> 10%).

Qualifiers.Scope: Determining the reference grade for calculating a daylight plane.
Qualifiers.Applicability: Daylight plane measurements for buildings abutting another site.

Figures: Figure 46 (Comparison of different grades; interior labels not fully legible)

grade_at_building_midpoint.description: Grade at the midpoint of the building (on the subject site).

grade_at_closest_point_on_abutting_site.description: Grade at the closest point on the abutting site.

average_grade_for_daylight_plane.description: Average grade used as the reference for the daylight plane.

Constants.definition_average_grade: Average grade = average of the grade at the midpoint of the building and the grade at the closest point on the abutting site.

then: Compute average_grade_for_daylight_plane as the mean of the midpoint grade and the closest abutting-site grade.
Use average_grade_for_daylight_plane as the reference grade for daylight plane calculations.

Relationships.description: Relies on grades from two distinct locations: the building midpoint and the closest point on the abutting site.
